title: two black sans serif
content:
1 RIEN

2 SCHIRN

Thankyou  
Greta

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/greta-02_5313.jpg)

 [‹ dewar's white label](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29297 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) ticklish logo - Platelet {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29291 "Go to next forum topic")
author: gretelz

comments.content:
’REIN’ — I think is Hoefler Knockout 90 from [Series G](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series_g.html).

’SCHIRN’ — I was tempted to say either Hoefler Gotham or Franklin Gothic, but neither is closed enough.

- Mike Yanega

thankyou both,

i think REIN is Knockout 90, yup.

SCHIRN still no clue.

gretel

[Akzidenz Grotesk Bold Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq/bold-extended/) is about the closest I have come to it, but the C and S are still not quite as closed as your sample. I can’t see the G well enough to use it to help with the ID.

- Mike Yanega

Yes, thank you. Let me look some more. (Still similar to A.G. if you need an alternative.)

- Mike Yanega

Well, I went through ALL 1,890 ’sansserif’ font families at MyFonts, and I can say that I don’t think it’s anything they sell — so it comes from an independent foundry.

The closest resemblances were [TS Formula](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/formula/) from TypeShop (which is probably a version of some other design — most of theirs seem to be); [Fuller Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/fuller-sans-dt/) from DTP Types; [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonSans/styles) from Font Bureau; [Paralucent](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142630/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/paralucent/) from Device; and I kept looking at Franklin Gothics of various foundries.

I will keep track of this thread to see what comes out, but I have made my attempt for now. Good luck.

- Mike Yanega

Thank you Mike.  
Thank you very much for your precious help.

gretel

<cite>Well, I went through ALL 1,890 ‘sansserif’ font families at MyFonts</cite>

:O

I bow to the master.

- Lex

Lex, That only shows how much tedium I can tolerate :)

(I really thought it was something that should have been a popular commercial font, but now I think it’s from a relatively obscure source.)

- Mike Yanega
